decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence by playing low-cost creatures and boosting them with powerful aura enchantments. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures that are difficult to deal with due to their hexproof ability and high power/toughness from enchantments like Ethereal Armor and Ancestral Mask. The mana base is designed to ensure smooth gameplay and consistent mana availability for casting both creatures and auras. The deck aims to win the game quickly by dealing large amounts of damage each turn.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent quickly with low-cost artifacts and creatures, fueled by card draw from spells like Thoughtcast and Perilous Research. The key creatures in this deck are Atog, Carapace Forger, Frogmite, and Myr Enforcer, which become powerful threats with the help of artifacts like Springleaf Drum and Darksteel Citadel. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Fling to finish off opponents or deal with threats. The synergy between artifacts and creatures is essential for a successful aggressive strategy in this Affinity deck.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells like Doom Blade and Chainer's Edict, while using cards like Pestilence and Prismatic Strands to maintain control over the game. The deck also gains life through cards like Aven Riftwatcher and Lone Missionary, while generating card advantage with Night's Whisper. With cards like Palace Sentinels and Guardian of the Guildpact, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes synergistic lands like Bojuka Bog and Orzhov Basilica.

This Boros Aggro deck is focused on efficient creature plays and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Glint Hawk to apply pressure early on, while also utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to control the board and target the opponent directly. With cards like Battle Screech and Palace Sentinels, the deck aims to maintain card advantage and keep up the aggression. The inclusion of utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Radiant Fountain adds versatility to the deck's strategy.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Tireless Tribe and Inside Out to deal massive amounts of unblockable damage to the opponent. This is achieved through drawing cards and manipulating the top of the library with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, while also utilizing counterspells like Circular Logic to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to win the game swiftly and efficiently by executing the combo at the right moment and overwhelming the opponent before they can adequately respond.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of cheap artifact creatures like Atog, Carapace Forger, and Frogmite, supported by mana acceleration from cards like Springleaf Drum and Prophetic Prism. Using cards like Galvanic Blast, Temur Battle Rage, and Fling to deal damage directly to the opponent or remove threats on the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures and powerful artifact synergies, leveraging the Affinity mechanic to make spells cheaper and faster to cast.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By using cards like Augur of Bolas and Mulldrifter to generate card advantage, along with countermagic like Counterspell and Prohibit to stop opposing threats, this deck aims to slow down the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Gurmag Angler as a powerful finisher, along with spells like Chainer's Edict for targeted removal, adds to the overall control aspect of the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to use the combo of Tireless Tribe with cards like Shadow Rift, Inside Out, and Circular Logic to quickly pump up the Tribe's power and win the game in one big swing. The deck focuses on drawing through the deck quickly with cards like Gitaxian Probe and Gush to find the combo pieces, while also running some control elements like Dispel and Augur of Bolas to protect the combo. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency in casting the combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient, low-cost creatures and pump spells to overwhelm the opponent with damage. The Mono Green Aggro archetype emphasizes speed and aggression, utilizing cards like Nest Invader, Skarrgan Pit-Skulk, and Rancor to apply early pressure. The deck also includes utility cards like Quirion Ranger and River Boa for additional versatility. By combining creature recursion with pump spells and combat tricks, this deck aims to win through early aggression and efficient combat.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive strategy utilizing cheap spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing efficient threats such as Kiln Fiend and Nivix Cyclops, the goal is to deal large amounts of damage in a short amount of time. The deck also includes ways to protect these creatures and push through for lethal damage, such as Mutagenic Growth, Apostle's Blessing, and Temur Battle Rage. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through aggressive plays and utilizing card draw and selection to ensure consistency in its aggressive plan.

This deck focuses on assembling the Urza's lands (Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate a massive amount of mana, allowing for powerful late-game plays. It uses control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to survive the early game, while also utilizing card draw and recursion with cards like Mulldrifter and Mnemonic Wall. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big game-ending spells like Ulamog's Crusher, Chainer's Edict, and Rolling Thunder. The key strategy is to efficiently control the game until the Urzatron can be established and take over.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their creatures, and eventually overwhelming them with card advantage. The key strategy is to efficiently control the board while setting up for powerful card draw and finishers like Gurmag Angler. Using efficient removal and card draw, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and win the game through attrition.

This Mono Green Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures and pumping them up with auras to overwhelm the opponent with efficient damage output. The key strategy of this deck is to maintain a continuous flow of threats on the board while utilizing cards like Quirion Ranger and Nettle Sentinel to generate extra mana and maintain momentum. By combining aggressive creatures with powerful aura enchantments, this deck aims to outpace and outmuscle the opponent in a fast-paced match-up.

The main focus of the Dimir Control deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing efficient creatures like Mulldrifter and Chittering Rats, along with recurring spells like Archaeomancer and Ghostly Flicker, the deck aims to outvalue opponents while disrupting their game plan. With a strong mana base and card selection from Preordain, the Dimir Control deck looks to grind out victories by controlling the battlefield and overwhelming opponents with its resource advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells to apply early pressure and finish the game quickly. It also includes value cards like Glint Hawk and Thraben Inspector to maintain tempo. Additionally, the deck includes some card draw and mana fixing tools like Prophetic Prism and Alchemist's Vial to ensure consistent plays. The mana base consists of artifact lands and bounce lands to help cast spells effectively. The strategy revolves around combining aggressive creatures with direct damage spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The Orzhov Pestilence deck focuses on controlling the board and gaining incremental advantage through lifegain and removal spells. It aims to stall the game with defensive creatures like Guardian of the Guildpact and Aven Riftwatcher, while using Pestilence as a win condition to wipe out opposing creatures. The deck also includes ways to gain life with cards like Lone Missionary and Wall of Hope, and card draw with Night's Whisper. Overall, the deck aims to grind out games and outlast opponents with its resilient creatures and removal suite.
